intro: Dryandra armata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia, where it typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in open woodlands and shrublands, thriving in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
